title: Love, American Style
content:
I'm looking for the typeface from "Love, American Style" or at least something similar.

| Attachment | Size |
| --- | --- |
| [lastylelogo.jpg](http://web.archive.org/web/20120415124245/http:/typophile.com/files/lastylelogo.jpg) | 16.49 KB |
author: vigorgraphics

comments.content: Old-school, pre-dig, hand-drawn illustration. Try [Cavetto](http://web.archive.org/web/20120415124245/http:/www.veer.com/partner/link.aspx?i=1048&c=4&p=products/typedetail.aspx?image=JBT0001000) or Jukebox's [Bookman](http://web.archive.org/web/20120415124245/http:/www.veer.com/partner/link.aspx?i=1048&c=4&p=products/typedetail.aspx?image=JBT0000085).

I had my eye on Bookman. I was just seeing if anyone else had another idea. Bookman it is! Thanks!

Joseph Szala  
Vigor Graphic Design, LLC.  
 [www.vigorgraphics.net](http://web.archive.org/web/20120415124245/http:/www.vigorgraphics.net/ "www.vigorgraphics.net")

If you want to be able to do the unicase setting, maybe have a look at [Gareth Hague](http://web.archive.org/web/20120415124245/http:/typophile.com/wiki/Gareth%20Hague)'s delicious [Perla](http://web.archive.org/web/20120415124245/http:/www.veer.com/products/typedetail.aspx?image=ALT0000117).
